body: When Mark Rosenthal suffered a stroke, he was too heavy and wide for a stretcher, so he made the jarring, bouncing dash to the hospital lying on an ambulance floor. The ride injured his back, and he felt as if his own weight would suffocate him. At the hospital, doctors wanted to give him an M.R.I. scan, but he could not fit into the machine. But
title: As Obesity Rises, Health Care Indignities Multiply

body: EVENTS CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK GRADUATE CENTER, 365 Fifth Avenue, at 34th Street. ''Intimacy and Geography: The National Asian American Poetry Festival,'' with readings, panels, discussions and performances. title: SPARE TIMES

body: Under yesterday's clear late-summer sky, flanked by two thousand firefighters frozen in white-gloved salute, nine men in dress blue uniforms slowly pulled a wooden casket from a fire truck and carried the box containing what remained of their final lost comrade into St. Bernard Roman Catholic Church. Inside the coffin lay no body in repose, only
title: TWO YEARS LATER: CEREMONY; Vial of Blood Is Laid to Rest As Fire Dept. Salutes Its Last

body: Jane Bodenheim's three-story brick townhouse in Cobble Hill, a hot Brooklyn neighborhood these days, is worth $1.4 million, according to New York City's assessors. John Hernandez's semi-detached home in the decidedly less hip and out-of-the-way Brooklyn neighborhood of Bergen Beach is valued at $387,000. Now guess who pays the higher property tax
title: Tax on Homes Is Inequitable, Study Finds

body: A man whose partly burned body was found on a kitchen floor in a home in Brooklyn on Wednesday night died from multiple gunshot wounds and was dead before his body was set on fire, the authorities said yesterday. The city medical examiner ruled the death a homicide and said the cause was gunshot wounds to the head, chest and extremities. The man,
title: Man Found Burned Was Shot, Police Say

body: The partly burned body of a 39-year-old man was discovered on his kitchen floor in Bergen Beach last night, the police said. The man, Andrew Puccini of 2415 East 73rd Street, was pronounced dead after he was found just before 8 p.m., the police said. His wife found the body, Firefighter Paul Iannizzotto said. Neighbors said Mr. Puccini used to own
title: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Burned Man Found Dead In Home
